text: The 1995–96 Bulgarian Cup was the 56th season of the Bulgarian Cup. Slavia Sofia won the competition, beating Levski Sofia in the final at the Vasil Levski National Stadium in Sofia. ==First round== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !Team 1 !Score !Team 2 |- !colspan=3 style="background-color:#D0F0C0;" |7 November 1995 |- |Spartak Pleven (II)||2–5||Slavia Sofia (I) |- !colspan=3 style="background-color:#D0F0C0;" |8 November 1995 |- |Edinstvo Gurkovo (III)||1–6||CSKA Sofia (I) |- |Atletik Velingrad (III)||7–1||Rakovski Ruse (I) |- |Shumen (I)||1–0||Akademik Sofia (II) |- |Ludogorets Razgrad (III)||0–1||Spartak Plovdiv (I) |- |Gigant Belene
